text: There are always a few who stand up in times of communal madness and have the courage to say that what unites us is greater than what divides us.

author: Vittorio Alfieri
text: Often the test of courage is not to die but to live.

author: Nikki Sixx
text: I had to find the courage to turn my life around.

author: Paul Johnson
text: Next to courage, willpower is the most important thing in politics.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
text: To dare to live alone is the rarest courage; since there are many who had rather meet their bitterest enemy in the field, than their own hearts in their closet.

author: Dean Koontz
text: Nothing gives us courage more readily than the desire to avoid looking like a damn fool.

author: Jesse Ventura
text: The first thing out of Fidel Castro's mouth to me, he looked me right in the eye and said, 'You're a man of great courage.'

author: Adam Driver
text: Acting is really about having the courage to fail in front of people.

text: We need men with moral courage to speak and write their real thoughts, and to stand by their convictions, even to the very death.

author: James A. Michener
text: It takes courage to know when you ought to be afraid.

author: e. e. cummings
text: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.

author: Marcia Angell
text: Probably most dying patients, even when suffering greatly, would choose to live as long as possible. That courage and grace should be protected and honored, and we should put every effort into treating their symptoms.

author: W. Clement Stone
text: Have the courage to say no. Have the courage to face the truth. Do the right thing because it is right. These are the magic keys to living your life with integrity.

author: Sarah Kay
text: To me, having the courage to tell your own story goes hand in hand with having the curiosity and humility to listen to others' stories.

author: Bethany Hamilton
text: Courage, sacrifice, determination, commitment, toughness, heart, talent, guts. That's what little girls are made of.

author: Gabby Douglas
text: Always be courageous and strong, and don't fear.

author: Emmanuel Macron
text: Believe in individual initiatives, in courage, in risk.

author: Mercy Otis Warren
text: The British were indeed very far superior to the Americans in every respect necessary to military operations, except the revivified courage and resolution, the result of sudden success after despair.

text: Since dogs could hear and smell better than men, we could concentrate on sight. Since courage is commonplace in dogs, men's adrenal glands could shrink. Dogs, by making us more efficient predators, gave us time to think. In short, dogs civilized us.

author: Joaquin Castro
text: I learned that Congress is a place with more heart than courage; there are more good souls in Washington than brave ones. I learned that the whole is not always the sum of its parts: that what you put in doesn't always match what you get out.

author: Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum
text: Most people talk; we do things. They plan; we achieve. They hesitate; we move ahead. We are living proof that when human beings have the courage and commitment to transform a dream into reality, there is nothing that can stop them.

author: Gabriele D'Annunzio
text: Limit to courage? There is no limit to courage.

author: Isabella Rossellini
text: If you see a person who's insecure and covers it up, it can be quite a problem. But the person who is insecure and shows you is quite appealing. They give you just the courage to drop your defenses.

author: Harper Lee
text: Real courage is when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what.

author: Nelson Mandela
text: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.

author: Joseph Addison
text: Courage that grows from constitution often forsakes a man when he has occasion for it; courage which arises from a sense of duty acts; in a uniform manner.

author: Publilius Syrus
text: Audacity augments courage; hesitation, fear.

author: John Slattery
text: I think the moments that are difficult for anybody are when you see what your life could be, if only you had the courage to take the steps needed.

author: Alexandra Fuller

author: Monica Ali
text: I like Beryl Bainbridge a great deal, and she is a writer who absolutely demands to be read a second, third, and fourth time. I admire her great courage in leaving so much unsaid and asking the reader to really engage her brain.

author: Paul Johnson
text: Courage is the essential element in any great public man or woman.

author: Pardis Sabeti

author: Ben Okri
text: One of the greatest gifts my father gave me - unintentionally - was witnessing the courage with which he bore adversity.

author: George Konrad
text: You take a number of small steps which you believe are right, thinking maybe tomorrow somebody will treat this as a dangerous provocation. And then you wait. If there is no reaction, you take another step: courage is only an accumulation of small steps.

author: John W. Gardner
text: Leaders come in many forms, with many styles and diverse qualities. There are quiet leaders and leaders one can hear in the next county. Some find strength in eloquence, some in judgment, some in courage.

author: Ken Adam
text: It takes courage to stay young, to make your enthusiasms work for you. Don't let anyone drag you down.

author: Silvia Cartwright

author: Miguel de Cervantes

author: Paul Keating
text: Well, I think that - I think leadership's always been about two main things: imagination and courage.

author: Jose Carreras
text: Yes, you must have the courage of being free.

author: Mignon McLaughlin
text: The only courage that matters is the kind that gets you from one moment to the next.

author: Maya Angelou
text: We have to confront ourselves. Do we like what we see in the mirror? And, according to our light, according to our understanding, according to our courage, we will have to say yea or nay - and rise!

author: Owen D. Young
text: It takes vision and courage to create - it takes faith and courage to prove.

author: Eamon de Valera

author: James Russell Lowell
text: Fate loves the fearless.

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
text: There is nothing in the world so much admired as a man who knows how to bear unhappiness with courage.

author: David Whyte
text: Poetry gives us courage and sets us straight with the world. Poems are great companions and friends.

author: Wendell Phillips
text: Physical bravery is an animal instinct; moral bravery is much higher and truer courage.

author: Bill Hunter

text: I adore themes of hope and courage and the ways we find meaning through suffering.

author: Athol Fugard
text: Without white South Africa realizing what it had done - and on the basis of that realization having the courage to ask for forgiveness - there can really be no significant movement.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: A great part of courage is the courage of having done the thing before.

author: Anais Nin
text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.

author: Gloria Steinem

author: Emeli Sande

author: Grace Paley
text: Let us go forth with fear and courage and rage to save the world.

author: Ray Comfort
text: It takes both courage and talent to stand up in front of fellow human beings and make them crack a smile, and at the same time keep it clean.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

author: Jonas Salk

author: Jerome Cady
text: It is a wise man who knows where courage ends and stupidity begins.

author: Walt Disney
text: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.

author: Muhammad Ali
text: He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life.

author: Patrick Campbell
text: There can be a fundamental gulf of gracelessness in a human heart which neither our love nor our courage can bridge.

author: Joseph Conrad
text: The last thing a woman will consent to discover in a man whom she loves, or on whom she simply depends, is want of courage.

author: Delmore Schwartz

author: William Shakespeare
text: Who could refrain that had a heart to love and in that heart courage to make love known?

author: Jenny Shipley
text: Peace is a fragile thing. It takes courage to secure it. It takes wisdom to maintain it.

text: Necessity does the work of courage.

text: Have the courage of your desire.

text: Good courage in a bad affair is half of the evil overcome.

text: Those who are rooted in the depths that are eternal and unchangeable and who rely on unshakeable principles, face change full of courage, courage based on faith.

text: Outlining is like putting on training wheels. It gives me the courage to write, but we always go off the outline.

text: We're going to be OK because of the American people. They have more grit, determination and courage than you can imagine.

text: And I think most people in this country want to see a president that's got the courage to say we're going to cut the tax burden, and reduce the regulatory climate, and we're going to get Americans working.

text: People talk about the courage of condemned men walking to the place of execution: sometimes it needs as much courage to walk with any kind of bearing towards another person's habitual misery.

text: I very much admired Lancaster. George Clooney reminds me of him today. Not all the macho, swinging around that Burt used to do, but the courage. You know where you stand with men like that.

text: I went through a long period where I was afraid of doing things I wanted to do, and you get your courage back, which is what's important.

author: Bill Frist
text: Just two weeks ago, millions of Iraqis defied the threats of terrorists and went to the polls to determine their own future. I congratulate the Iraqi people for the courage they've shown in making these elections so successful.

author: Vash Young
text: All my life I had feared to-morrow, until I decided to have faith and to live to-day in courage.

author: Maya Angelou
text: History, despite its wrenching pain, cannot be unlived, but if faced with courage, need not be lived again.

text: Sadly, far too many politicians in Washington lack the courage to do something to fix our problems. They are worried about the political implications of making the hard choices we so desperately need to cut spending and shrink government.

author: Lucy Walker
text: My main trick is to work with amazing people. It's a long and twisty journey, and you need people that really are amazing and have this rare gift of honesty and courage and really open up.

text: It takes a good deal of physical courage to ride a horse. This, however, I have. I get it at about forty cents a flask, and take it as required.

author: E. M. Forster
text: Either life entails courage, or it ceases to be life.

text: Alas, nothing reveals man the way war does. Nothing so accentuates in him the beauty and ugliness, the intelligence and foolishness, the brutishness and humanity, the courage and cowardice, the enigma.

text: People think I have courage. The courage in my family are my wife Pam, my three daughters, here, Nicole, Jamie, LeeAnn, my mom, who's right here too.

text: Courage is the most important of all the virtues, because without courage you can't practice any other virtue consistently. You can practice any virtue erratically, but nothing consistently without courage.

text: When I was 16 the first girl I had a crush on wasn't interested at all. I liked her from afar for ages, and when I eventually got the courage and told her, and she wasn't into me.

author: Winston Churchill
text: Courage is rightly esteemed the first of human qualities... because it is the quality which guarantees all others.

author: Richard Flanagan
text: In all the writers I admire, the common detonator is their courage to walk naked.

author: Rahm Emanuel
text: Today, because of President Obama's courage, kids can stay on their parent's plan until they are 26. Insurers cannot kick you off your policy because you have hit your limit. They will not be able to deny you because you have a pre-existing condition.

author: John Ciardi
text: It is easy enough to praise men for the courage of their convictions. I wish I could teach the sad young of this mealy generation the courage of their confusions.

author: Confucius
text: Faced with what is right, to leave it undone shows a lack of courage.

author: Chris Bell
text: I think that people need to have the courage of their convictions and not be trying to fool people into thinking that they've changed overnight.

author: Mickey Mantle
text: A team is where a boy can prove his courage on his own. A gang is where a coward goes to hide.

author: John Murray
text: Give the people not hell, but hope and courage.

author: Ernest Hemingway
text: Courage is grace under pressure.

author: Sydney Smith
text: Have the courage to be ignorant of a great number of things, in order to avoid the calamity of being ignorant of everything.

author: Saint Francis de Sales
text: Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections.

author: Oriana Fallaci
text: It is the mainspring of life, courage. And courage has many faces.

author: Douglas Coupland
text: If human beings had genuine courage, they'd wear their costumes every day of the year, not just on Halloween.

author: Ron Fournier
text: Washington's answer to a self-inflicted financial crisis reminded Americans why they so deeply distrust the political class. The 'fiscal cliff' process was secretive and sloppy, and the nation's so-called leadership lacked the political courage to address our root problems: joblessness and debt.

author: Jeff Buckley
text: I'm sick of all these labels and these manufactured subdivisions of music that don't even exist. And even though I'm pierced myself, I'm sick of everyone equating body piercing with musical courage. If you ask me, it takes a lot more than that.

author: Jeff Koons
text: I believe that art has been a vehicle for me that's been about enlightenment and expanding my own parameters, to give me courage to exercise the freedom that I have in life.

author: Andrew Shue
text: Life is the most exciting opportunity we have. But we have one shot. You graduate from college once, and that's it. You're going out of that nest. And you have to find that courage that's deep, deep, deep in there. Every step of the way.

author: Louis D. Brandeis
text: Those who won our independence... valued liberty as an end and as a means. They believed liberty to be the secret of happiness and courage to be the secret of liberty.

author: Catherine the Great
text: I beg you take courage; the brave soul can mend even disaster.

author: Confucius
text: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.

author: Ronald Reagan
text: There are no easy answers, but there are simple answers. We must have the courage to do what we know is morally right.

author: Kristian Bush
text: I believe the biggest challenge is just getting the courage to try something different or new. Try to forget the stereotype in your mind. Yoga is for everyone - children, athletes, moms, dads, accountants, truck drivers, even country stars.

author: Alexander Berkman
text: War paralyzes your courage and deadens the spirit of true manhood.

author: Brie Larson
text: To find the courage to do what I want to do for myself has been hard.

author: Muammar al-Gaddafi
text: We are telling the American people to have patience, courage, resolve and determination.

author: William Slim
text: Moral courage is higher and a rarer virtue than physical courage.

author: Michael Kinsley
text: He's nice enough not to want to be associated with a nasty remark but not nice enough not to make it. Lacking the courage of one's nastiness does not make one nice.

author: Wilfred Grenfell
text: Courage is always the surest wisdom.

author: Li Keqiang
text: In fighting the debt crisis, E.U. countries have enhanced co-operation and carried out reform with tremendous courage. This is laudable.

author: Mark Twain
text: It is curious that physical courage should be so common in the world and moral courage so rare.

author: Venkatraman Ramakrishnan
text: It takes a certain amount of courage to tackle very hard problems in science, I now realise. You don't know what the timescale of your work will be: decades or only a few years.

author: Jose Carreras
text: Everybody, even me, sometimes had to compromise on something, doing things we know to be wrong, and this happens doing whatever job in the world. But a singer must have the courage of saying no.

author: Harry S Truman
text: Men make history and not the other way around. In periods where there is no leadership, society stands still. Progress occurs when courageous, skillful leaders seize the opportunity to change things for the better.

author: Andre Gide
text: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.

author: Tori Amos
text: Healing takes courage, and we all have courage, even if we have to dig a little to find it.

author: Paul Tillich
text: Decision is a risk rooted in the courage of being free.

author: Victoria Pendleton
text: We don't talk about courage much in our everyday conversations, but I am comfortable with it now.

author: Plato
text: Courage is knowing what not to fear.

author: John Milius
text: Most of the good executives do pretty well. Because to be a good executive you have to be strong, and you have to have a simple attribute that people have forgotten about - courage.

author: Robert Peel

author: Jewel
text: Love bravely, live bravely, be courageous, there's really nothing to lose. There's no wrong you can't make right again, so be kinder to yourself, you know, have fun, take chances. There's no bounds.

author: Samuel Ullman
text: In the central place of every heart, there is a recording chamber; so long as it receives messages of beauty, hope, cheer and courage, you are young.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
text: Just as courage imperils life, fear protects it.

author: Harold Prince
text: Nobody has yet proven that taking a chance and doing something unique that an audience isn't used to is a bad idea. What the theater lacks is that kind of courage.

author: Andre Malraux
text: Often the difference between a successful person and a failure is not one has better abilities or ideas, but the courage that one has to bet on one's ideas, to take a calculated risk - and to act.

author: Julia Stiles
text: I'm slowly working up the courage to sing in front of other people, but I can carry a tune. I do some mean karaoke.

text: A great deal of talent is lost to the world for want of a little courage. Every day sends to their graves obscure men whose timidity prevented them from making a first effort.

author: Margaret J. Wheatley
text: Determination, energy, and courage appear spontaneously when we care deeply about something. We take risks that are unimaginable in any other context.

author: Ray Bradbury
text: Jump, and you will find out how to unfold your wings as you fall.

author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan
text: Remember that when you meet your antagonist, to do everything in a mild agreeable manner. Let your courage be keen, but, at the same time, as polished as your sword.

author: Pam Brown
text: The courage of very ordinary people is all that stands between us and the dark.

author: Dean Smith

author: Alexandre Vinet

author: Gerry Adams

author: Robert Anthony
text: Courage is simply the willingness to be afraid and act anyway.

text: Falsehood is cowardice, the truth courage.

text: Being gifted needs courage.

text: To live we must conquer incessantly, we must have the courage to be happy.

text: Believers, look up - take courage. The angels are nearer than you think.

text: You live with the fear people might find out. Then you actually have the courage to tell people and they go, I don't think you are gay. It's enough to drive you crazy.

text: Courage, my friends; 'tis not too late to build a better world.

author: Morihei Ueshiba

text: Hope, like faith, is nothing if it is not courageous; it is nothing if it is not ridiculous.

text: When God speaks, oftentimes His voice will call for an act of courage on our part.

author: J. R. R. Tolkien
text: Courage is found in unlikely places.

text: Just as courage is the danger of life, so is fear its safeguard.

text: With honesty of purpose, balance, a respect for tradition, courage, and, above all, a philosophy of life, any young person who embraces the historical profession will find it rich in rewards and durable in satisfaction.

author: Edward Gibbon
text: The courage of a soldier is found to be the cheapest and most common quality of human nature.

text: What is more mortifying than to feel that you have missed the plum for want of courage to shake the tree?

author: Lao Tzu
text: From caring comes courage.

author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.

author: Kenny Loggins
text: Courage is always rewarded.

author: John Rhys-Davies

text: Readers of fiction read, I think, for a deeper embrace of the world, of reality. And that's brave. I never get over being thankful for that - for the courage of my readers.

author: Lech Walesa
text: Lying at the root of the social agreements of 1980 are the courage, sense of responsibility, and the solidarity of the working people. Both sides have then recognized that an accord must be reached if bloodshed is to be prevented.

author: Henry Van Dyke
text: Genius is talent set on fire by courage.

author: Chesty Puller
text: In the Confederate Army, an officer was judged by stark courage alone, and this made it possible for the Confederacy to live four years.

author: Susana Martinez
text: Success, they taught me, is built on the foundation of courage, hard-work and individual responsibility. Despite what some would have us believe, success is not built on resentment and fears.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
text: A man of courage is also full of faith.

author: Ronald Reagan
text: Above all, we must realize that no arsenal, or no weapon in the arsenals of the world, is so formidable as the will and moral courage of free men and women. It is a weapon our adversaries in today's world do not have.

author: Jeremy Collier
text: True courage is a result of reasoning. A brave mind is always impregnable.
